courses.name: Topics in Music-Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects vary from semester to semester. May be repeated once for additional credit with departmental consent.

courses.name: Music Travel Course
courses.description: Study tour designed to broaden perspective of persons interested in music. Stresses relationship of music to art and ideas in a variety of social and cultural contexts. Participant bears cost of course.

courses.name: Problems in Music
courses.description: Independent investigation leading to a paper project.  Sections are: Music Theory, Music Composition, Music History, Music Performance/Pedagogy.  May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Music I
courses.description: Introduction to rhythmic, melodic, harmonic, and structural elements of music. Designed for non-music majors. No credit for music majors or minors.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Music II
courses.description: Continuation of MUSIC_NM 1211. No credit for music majors or minors.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUSIC_NM 1211

courses.name: Experiencing Music Through Concert Attendance
courses.description: Development of music listening skills through concert attendance, reading and class attendance.

courses.name: Masterpieces of Western Music
courses.description: Introduction to the Western fine-art tradition through the study of representative masterworks, emphasis on developing listening skills; directed to non-majors.

courses.name: Jazz, Pop, and Rock
courses.description: Historical introduction to jazz (to approximately 1970) and the American popular song, including rock and roll (to approximately 1980); directed to non-majors.

courses.name: History of Jazz
courses.description: Historical survey of American jazz from its origin to the present. No credit for students who have taken MUSIC_NM 1311.

courses.name: Introduction to World Music
courses.description: Introduction to the musical traditions of selected non-Western societies; emphasis on developing listening skills; directed to non-majors, but music majors may enroll.

courses.name: Orchestral Masterpieces
courses.description: In-depth study of selected symphonic works of masters from Joseph Haydn to Aaron Copland.  Students develop critical listening skills to identify orchestral instruments and perceive the structure and character of selected orchestral works.  Directed to non-music majors.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Musical Profile-Bach
courses.description: Systematic study of the music of J.S. Bach directed to the general student.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Music Profile--Wolfgang A. Mozart
courses.description: A systematic introduction to the music of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Musical Profile-Beethoven
courses.description: Systematic study of the music of Ludwig van Beethoven directed to the general student.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Music Profile--Claude Debussy
courses.description: A systematic introduction to the music of Claude Debussy. Graded on A/-F basis only.

courses.name: Music Profile--Igor Stravinsky
courses.description: A systematic introduction to the music of Igor Stravinsky. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Musical Profile-Copland
courses.description: Systematic study of the music of Aaron Copland directed to the general student.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Introduction to African-American Music
courses.description: Introduction to the history and scholarship of African American music from eighteenth through twentieth centuries. Focus on African legacies and retentions, slave culture, the black church, minstrelsy, folk traditions, spirituals, ragtime, blues, jazz, soul, R&B, and hip hop.

courses.name: Introduction to Soul and Country
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 1335).  Examination of musical cultures signified by "soul" and "country".  Study of the evolution and aesthetics of these genres and how they deal with concepts like identity, class, race, and ethnicity; gender and sexuality; politics and patriotism.

courses.name: Music of Love and Death
courses.description: Exploration of musical expression surrounding love and death in specific works of diverse styles and sociological contexts.  Students will learn to listen to and appreciate music with informed ears and minds, develop strong perceptual skills, and cultivate a musical vocabulary.

courses.name: Drama Through Western Music
courses.description: Introduction to the musical culture of the theater through the ages by examining specific works of diverse styles and sociological contexts.  Students learn to listen to and appreciate music with informed ears and minds, develop perceptual skills, and cultivate musical vocabulary.

courses.name: Studio Instruction
courses.description: Acceptable for non-majors and majors requiring a half-hour lesson with instructor's consent. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Beginning Piano Class
courses.description: For non-music majors only.

courses.name: Intermediate Piano Class
courses.description: For non-music majors only. Continuation of MUSIC_NM 1608.

courses.name: Elementary Folk Guitar Class
courses.description: Teaching correct hand position, strum patterns, and chords needed for accompaniment of popular and folk songs.

courses.name: Beginning Classical Guitar Class
courses.description: Beginning Classical Guitar Class

courses.name: Beginning Drumset
courses.description: Fundamentals of the drumset, including an historical survey and biographical sketch of several performers. Also can be used as a pedagogical outline for future music teachers.

courses.name: Basic Musicianship
courses.description: Development of musicianship through music reading, playing, creating, and perceptive listening, including study of pitch, rhythm, structure, style, expressive and interpretive elements, and related vocabulary. No credit for music majors or minors or students who have completed MUSIC_NM 1211 or MUSIC_NM 1212.

courses.name: Voice Class I
courses.description: Fundamentals of singing: posture, breath support, control, vocalization, concepts of tone quality, placement and resonance. Literature selected for students with no previous vocal training. Adapted to needs of drama and other interdisciplinary students.

courses.name: Voice Class II
courses.description: Continuation of  MUSIC_NM 1651.

courses.name: Perceiving Musical Traditions and Styles
courses.description: An introduction to music from the late Baroque to the present day, including fine art, folk, and popular music.  Designed to serve as a foundation for developing knowledge and skills of musical perception that will eventually lead to thoughtful written commentary on musical performances.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: open only to Journalism majors with sophomore standing or higher

courses.name: Perceiving Musical Traditions and Styles - Honors
courses.description: An introduction to music from the late Baroque to the present day, including fine art, folk, and popular music.  Designed to serve as a foundation for developing knowledge and skills of musical perception that will eventually lead to thoughtful written commentary on musical performances.  Graded on A/F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: open only to Journalism majors with sophomore standing or higher.  Honors eligibility required

courses.name: Live Music: Up Close and Personal
courses.description: Study of classical chamber music from 1770-present through live performances. Artistic, cultural and historical contexts; development of listening skills and basic music vocabulary. No credit for music majors and music minors.

courses.name: History of the Classical Guitar
courses.description: Historical development of the classical guitar and guitar music from 1400 to today.
courses.recommendation: Humanities credit for any and all non-music majors

courses.name: Studio Instruction for Non-Majors
courses.description: Acceptable for non-majors only. May be repeated for credit.
courses.prerequisites: audition by examining committee and instructor's consent

courses.name: Studio Instruction for Non-Majors
courses.description: Acceptable for non-majors only.  May be repeated for credit.
courses.prerequisites: audition by examining committee and instructor's consent

courses.name: Travel Seminar
courses.description: Selected topics for directed study in music undertaken in context of the tour. Emphasis on subjects with cross-disciplinary implications. Participant bears cost of course.

courses.name: Studio Instruction for Non-Majors
courses.description: Acceptable for graduate s credit for non-majors only. May be repeated for credit.
